meanings.definition: A former British coin worth one twentieth of a pound.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people used shillings to buy small things like candy.
meanings.sent2: I paid for the toy with a few shillings I had in my pocket.
meanings.sent3: Why did the penny go to school? To learn how to become a shillings!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a shiny shillings in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The sound of shillings jingling in his pocket was music to his ears.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in various countries, including Kenya and Uganda.
meanings.sent1: She exchanged her dollars for Kenyan shillings before the trip.
meanings.sent2: The market vendor quoted the price in shillings for the fruits.
meanings.sent3: Why did the wallet break up with the coins? It found a new love in shillings!
meanings.sent4: The idea of kindness spreading like shillings in a fountain delighted her.
meanings.sent5: The colorful shillings in the market made it feel like a vibrant painting.
